data.title: Board of Directors
data.meta_site_name: St. Louis Blues Blind Hockey Club
data.text:
PRESIDENT & COACH

Jeff is level 4 USA Hockey Certified and has coached in the Kirkwood Youth Hockey Association. (Mini-Mite through Midget AA) He brings his experience with the American Development Model (ADM) to Blues Blind Hockey in effort to focus on individual player development as well as team concepts learned through the many experiences he has had with other great coaches over the past 11 years.

Jeff is also the Vice President of St. Louis Recreation Development Group and worked with Sean Borah and the board members of Spirit of Discovery Park to bring blind hockey to St. Louis. It is his goal to make St. Louis Blues Blind Hockey THE model club in U.S. and Canadian Blind Hockey.

COMMUNITY RELATIONS LIAISON

Jamie is a servant leader fulfilling her core belief: to bring great value and create equality, fairness, and inclusion for others. Having more than 20+ years of experience as a “Get-it- Done” serial entrepreneur, she founded, co-founded, and successfully ran six businesses, two being non-profits. Jamie's professional experience includes being a catalyst for pioneers in the inclusion environment. As President and Founder of NPO, Spirit of Discovery Park, she helped serve and raise awareness for ALL abilities and contributes additional change for the greater good by co-founding St. Louis Blues Blind Hockey Club, with her husband. Collaboratively, these entities have altered the disabled lens and something that makes her truly proud.

TREASURER

David Fields is a pastor and educator who possesses an intense desire to see the lives of his students made better. He and his wife Heidi are parents to three beautiful children including their youngest who was born with congenital glaucoma and has fought through thirty-one eye surgeries to make his way to the ice. David is currently pursuing a Ph.D. in Organizational Leadership and hopes his education will enable him to be more than just a passionate parent, but to help the St. Louis Blues Blind Hockey Club to be a world-class organization that affords the visually impaired opportunities to play the game they love.

DIRECTOR OF MARKETING & ON-ICE COACH

John Kruszka is the father to two boys currently playing hockey at the youth club and high school levels and has coached age levels from 8U to 16U. The General Manager of Zane Williams, a large format print marketing services provider, John has nearly 30 years of experience in leadership of private and public companies in the print, direct marketing, advertising, fulfillment, and business services areas. His philosophy is that coaching and managing are much of the same skillset whether it’s with mite to midget hockey players or sales teams to operations staff – offering encouragement, leading by example, training folks to get to the next level, and in the end giving 100% effort no matter the outcome.

BOARD SECRETARY & GOALTENDING COACH

Pete stepped up one day for us by playing goalie during an exhibition game. He loved working with the players so we asked if he would help out more. Pete jumped on the opportunity and got between the pipes to give our players a real "tendie" to shoot on.

Since then, we have acquired a blind goaltender who Pete focuses on. Pete is new to coaching but we have already seen significant improvements in our net minder!

DIRECTOR OF PLAYER DEVELOPMENT & HEAD COACH

Mary Beth is a USA Hockey Level 2 Certified Coach and has coached two years for the Kirkwood Youth Hockey Association at the Mite and Squirt levels. She has a degree in Special Education and taught in Alternative Schools in Chicago and St. Louis. Mary Beth uses her knowledge of hockey and Special Education to adapt techniques in teaching skating and the game of hockey for our Learn-to-play team.

PLAYER REPRESENTATIVE & TEAM CAPTAIN

Liam has always had an interest in promoting fitness and athletics for blind and visually impaired and now, helping grow blind hockey since he started playing with the Blues Blind Hockey Club in 2018. Since then, he has enjoyed traveling with teammates to participate in multiple annual adapted hockey events including the Blind Hockey Classic, the Disabled Hockey Festival, and the Windy City Blind Hockey Showdown in Chicago. In 2023 Liam was invited to attend training camp events with the US National Blind Hockey team.

Liam is also involved with MindsEye Radio, which provides other adaptive sport opportunities as well as audio description services for live events. He states, "this helps me stay connected to the blindness community at various levels and connect with multiple groups of people."

Outside of adaptive sports, Liam works full-time in the department of ophthalmology and visual sciences at Washington University as a laboratory researcher.
